utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: What brings you here today?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hi I am having difficulties breathing and I've just had this cough and it's, It's been two months now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Two months, so did the two months of the difficulty breathing or the cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Two months of difficulty breathing and the cough is gotten worse. I've had a cough for a couple years now. I'm a smoker.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and is is this cough different at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's just, it just doesn't go away.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and when did the shortness of breath start?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: About two months ago.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and is it getting worse?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: oh yeah

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Are you bringing up any sputum at all with your cough?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm? I sometimes uhm, yeah I do.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK and is is there any color to it or is it clear?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: it's pink in color

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: It's pink in color?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Hmm

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Ok. Have you coughed up any blood at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sometimes

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: sometimes?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Streaks of blood here and there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Little streaks of blood? OK, and have you ever coughed up any just without without it being in the sputum, just onto a tissue or anything like that? Just coughing up any blood?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. So an are your symptoms just constant over the last two months or do they come and go?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Shortness of breath just kind of stays.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and is there anything that helps with your shortness of breath, like taking a rest or any positions in particular?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, sometimes resting does help. I find that it's worse when I'm moving around, I'm huffing and puffing more.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and is it worse at all when you lay down?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No? And do you find yourself ever having to wake up at night and gasp gasping for air?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, it hasn't gotten that far but seeing how bad it's been over the past two months and how fast is progressing, I won't be surprised if I can't even sleep. It's been quite difficult I I don't even know why I waited so long. I should have come in earlier.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Well, I'm glad you came in today. We can definitely try and help you with what's going on. Do you at all use any kind of medications to help you with your symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I've just been using my inhalers a bit more but they don't always help.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and what are you using the inhalers for?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh, I have COPD.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: COPD? OK, and when were you diagnosed?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's been 15 years now.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: 15 years and do you know the how many puffers are you taking?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, I'm taking uhm, I'm taking two puffers.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you have one that that you take when you when you absolutely need it?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah I do. That's the one that I've been trying to use but

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Has it been less effective at all recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, it hasn't been helping. The blue one I tried to keep taking the blue one and it's just, you know it's not helping.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you been sick at all recently with fever? Chills, like runny nose? Any cold like symptoms?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, nothing like that? Have you been in contact with anyone that's been sick?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh no. I've been staying at home. I've been very careful these days.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah for sure. Any so this started two months ago? Are you having, so you have not traveled then I'm assuming?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, are you having any kind of dizziness or fainting spells?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh no, no no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No? OK, any kind of swelling in your legs or hands that you've notice?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Any headaches at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No. Well, sometimes I do. But it's not been severe. It's been there for the past uhm always when I'm stressed out I get these headaches. It's nothing new.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any nausea or vomiting?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No? Any diarrhea or Constipation?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No OK, any fevers or chills recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I have a mild fever. It just, it's been there.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: When did you notice?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm I was just checking my temperature about a month ago and noticed that I had a fever.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. This was a month ago?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Have you had it recently at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I haven't checked it recently, but I do feel a little hot.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, are you getting night sweats at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sometimes.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Sometimes, OK. And are you getting any kind of significant weight loss?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, then your weight's been fine?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's been the same. Although I have been eating quite a lot more now with the pandemic and being home, you know that might be still in the same.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And so are you having, do you feel like tired throughout the day or increased fatigue?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh my God. So tired I can, you know, with the difficulty breathing I feel like all my energy spent just trying to, trying to get to the bathroom.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how? Is there like? How much do you walk or move around that you get short of breath? Or are you short of breath at rest as well?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm? I'm short of breath all the time. Yeah, it's just, It's it's worse when I am moving.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: And so you've been diagnosed with COPD. Have you had to use oxygen at home at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No OK, how about have you had any hospitalizations in the past for your COPD?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, I had a had a couple last year.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: A couple of hospitalizations?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, yeah. About four hospitalizations last year.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Oh, I see. And and did you have to use any oxygen in the hospital?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah yeah I did. I did.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: They never sent you home with any like oxygen tank or anything like that? OK.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Although they told me my COPD was pretty bad. That I might need to get oxygen at some point.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see. And have you, when you in hospital, did they give you antibiotics or when you went home?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah. Yeah they did. they did.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Did they tell you you had pneumonia at all at any point?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I don't think so.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No. OK, OK any any changes or do you get any chest pain at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm, sometimes when I breathe in very deep.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: I see. Any any kind of sensation that your heart is racing?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No. OK Any kind of issues with your sleep or appetite?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Umm. Well, no, not really. It's just the difficulty breathing sometimes it's been hard to sleep.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, any any exposure to any fumes or allergens in your household, any animals, pets?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And other than COPD, have you been diagnosed with any medical conditions in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I'm pretty healthy otherwise.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, do you have any allergies at all to medications or environmental allergies?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'm allergic to cats.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: To cats, OK, do you have a cat?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No OK. Have you been around any cats recently?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No OK, are you on any medications besides the puffers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Nope

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and so you use the ventolin and then what's the other puffer that you use?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Uhm I don't remember the name.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you know the color at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: It's orange

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: orange OK. So you've had four hospitalizations in the past year. Any surgeries in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I had a knee replacement on my right side.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and when was that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: 10 years ago

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Do you have any family history of any lung conditions, heart conditions, any cancers?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: My dad had COPD as well.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And any lung cancers in the family?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: no.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, so currently do you work at all?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I'm retired.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and what did you do before you retired?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I was I was a mechanic at Chrysler's.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and during your work, were you ever exposed to any chemicals or any kind of in your workplace or home exposed to any asbestos or anything like that?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Not that I'm aware of.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. And how long have you been smoking for?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Oh yeah, I was a teenager when I started.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and how much do you smoke on a on a daily basis?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I smoke, I smoke a pack a day

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK. Have you at all tried to quit before?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: I can't quit. It's not gonna happen. A lot of people have told me try to quit but I I just can't live without it and I'm 75 now, you know. Like I'm not gonna live a lot longer anyway.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah yeah but also even if you try to cut down some of your symptoms might get better. Like even though you're 75, you can definitely have improvement in some of your symptoms that you're having, like the shortness of breath and coughing. So if at all that you you want to consider cutting down and gradually. we can talk about that more as well.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sure

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and do you use any recreational drugs like marijuana?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Do you drink?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: No, OK, so yeah, those are all the questions I have for you. Do you have any questions for me?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: No, I just I guess I need to be admitted right? Just like those other COPD exacerbations? I'm thinking this is exactly that and I'll have to stay in the hospital, right? for a couple of days

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Yeah, so we definitely before deciding on whether or not you should be admitted, since you said the Ventolin is not working for you, we will definitely give you some some ventilation and perhaps steroid for just to get rid of some of your symptoms right now, and we want to also make sure since you're having like cough as well as shortness of breath to do a covid swab on you, just in case. I know you've been like isolating and everything, but just in case I will do that and we'll get like a chest x ray on you as well, just to see if there's any kind of pneumonia going on. And then from there we'll also get your blood work, and then from there we'll see whether or not you will require another admission.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sure.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: OK, and there you might, I'm not 100% sure, but you might require home oxygen if like we take your vitals and everything and your oxygenation is very low. Have you have you been talked about that at all in the past?

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Yeah, they talked about it last time I've been trying to avoid it, but if it has to happen, it has to happen.

utterances.speaker: doctor
utterances.text: Hmm yeah, and it might just sometimes just, you know you've had four admissions in the past and it might actually just help you stay at home if you are on oxygen. Anyways, yeah we can talk about that. We'll do like a full physical examination everything and go from there.

utterances.speaker: patient
utterances.text: Sure.

utterances.speaker: control
utterances.text: Add differential diagnosis
